clean_trail_start: ^Hübris: "this branch is too hot to ship"
^Hübris: "if he crosses borders with this commit history, he's black-bagged at customs"
^Stack pulls up the repo. Unhinged commit messages. Radioactive code. Evidence of... everything.
^Stack: "we can't just delete it. this is months of work."
^Hübris: "which is why we ARCHIVE it. safe. offline. then we scrub the public trail."
^Try to salvage what we can (risky, preserves value)
rtc_all: ^You watch the branch get archived. Then scrubbed. Then burned.
^SYSTEM: Commit history rewritten. Public repos sanitized.
^Hübris: "we SAVED it. offline. safe. but yeah, publicly? gone."
^The crew sits in silence. It feels like burning a masterpiece.
archive_and_scrub: ^Roo: "we keep the core. everything else burns."
^You archive the critical work to an offline drive. Then scrub the public repos clean.
^SYSTEM: Selective archive complete. Public trail sanitized.
^Stack: "at least we kept the important stuff"
^The Heat drops. Not as much as full RTC, but enough.
^SYSTEM: Border risk reduced. Extraction window improved.
salvage_attempt: ^Roo: "we try to keep it. rewrite commits, sanitize the history, but preserve the work."
^You spend hours rewriting git history. Sanitizing messages. Trying to make it look clean.
^It's exhausting. And it's not quite working.
^SYSTEM: Partial sanitization complete. Some risk remains.
^Stack: "i don't think this is clean enough"
^The Heat drops slightly. The work is mostly intact. But you know it's not really safe.
^Roo: "we'll deal with it if we have to"
